snippet: A new general manager, coach and quarterback helped Kansas City transform from a 2-14 team in 2012 to a squad that went 11-5 and secured a playoff spot in 2013.
abstract: Ben Shpigel On Pro Football column observes that Kansas City Chiefs' new general manager, coach and quarterback have all helped transform Chiefs from 2-14 team in 2012 to squad that went 11-5 and secured a playoff spot in 2013; suggests New York Jets might view Kansas City's success as blueprint for turning their own losing season around.
lead_paragraph: A new general manager, coach and quarterback helped Kansas City transform from a 2-14 team in 2012 to a squad that went 11-5 and secured a playoff spot in 2013.

headline.main: To Rebuild, Jets Can Use Chiefs’ Blueprint
headline.print_headline: To Rebuild, Jets Can Use Chiefs’ Blueprint
